review_title: Student Job as Event Staff--nothing to brag home about
job_title: Event Staff in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Doing this job, you learn many different types of work, including: customer service, operating a scoreboard, scanning tickets, selling tickets, and other occasional duties that come with sports events. Joe and the other supervisors are great people and are totally reasonable if you cannot make it to work for a verifiable reason (like if your car breaks down).
cons: It is a student job, so you only get paid minimum wage ($8/hr) and if you get promoted to Event Supervisor, it's only a 0.25 increase to pay. Coworkers can be hit or miss with reliability, so you might get stuck on the job longer if your shift replacement is late or doesn't show up. Lastly, it's honestly a really boring job, most of the time you will be standing around, watching people or the game you are at. There's not that much to get out of working here, but hours are hours.

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: It was very convenient to work where I was attending school.  My job as an undergraduate research assistant was in my field of study (Biotechnology) and gave me invaluable experience that helped me land my first job before I'd even finished all my classes.  I loved being able to spend more time on campus and be more involved as well.
cons: Pay is minimum wage, but that didn't bother me and I didn't expect anything more.  There were limits to the number of hours I could work which had to be considered when starting experiments but that was also not that big of a deal.

job_title: Professor in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: The people in my department are fantastic, and have been very welcoming and kind. The administrative support have been awesome whenever I need technical assistance in my classroom.
cons: Because of the budget crisis there is a looming uncertainty about the stability of jobs, therefore, it feels at times like many people who work here are nervous about the stability of their employment here.

job_title: L2 Student Consultant in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Learnt customer service, great co-workers, interesting work and good supervisors.  It is very rewarding work, as you get to help students, faculty and staff get through their technology difficulties.
cons: Upper management does not plan for the future problems and scrambles for quick solutions (usually budget cuts).  Student workers do not get paid a fair wage,

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Flexibility - half of the work (such as grading and reporting) can be done on your own time. Which ever class you TA for, you end up learning a lot without homework and tests.
cons: Budgets sometimes don't allow for you to get paid for the time you put in. The University prefers to hire people who have financial aid paying for work time.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Best reason to work at SCSU is the beautiful campus as it is located right along the Mississippi River.  In addition, the administration seems to care for their employees and has a proactive attitude when it comes to dealing with employee relations.
cons: The con you face working at SCSU is that the parking situation for faculty is worse than most Universities.  They simply don't appear to have enough parking to most buildings.  This is really an issue during the winter months when the students will risk tickets and take any parking they can get so they are not walking in the sub-zero weather.

job_title: Community Advisor in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Helps having free room and board. Provides great experiences that can transfer into the workforce.
cons: Management seems to be focused more on catching students breaking policy as apposed to teaching students. Workload is unreasonable.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Olivia, MN
pros: Was able to work about whenever I wanted, and only needed to put in a handful of hours each week.  Was ideal for earning a little bit but not needing to put in 20 hours a week.
cons: Low pay, but that's to be expected. It's not skilled labor or anything. Sometimes there would be much more to do (when a large assignment needed to be graded) so it could become somewhat inconsistent.

job_title: Facilities Assistant in Plymouth, MN
pros: Excellent way to gain and reinforce technical skills. Great networking opportunity with different students and faculty in industry. Great for students starting out.
cons: No higher technical support on readily campus when I worked there so when weekends came it was difficult at times to receive needed advanced IT support. However, they now have an advanced IT personnel who works with our campus twice a week to ensure higher level issues are resolved.

review_title: Good place to learn the ropes
job_title: Grad Assistant in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Provides a creative environment for you to foster your abilities and skills. Great place to develop professionalism with less of the consequences in your early years.
cons: Lack of campus cohesiveness which leads to inefficiency and low productivity. Lack of transparency in decisions that affect all employees. Expect bureaucracy.

review_title: Above average for the public sector
job_title: in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Excellent job security, well-defined job descriptions, excellent benefits, supporting a good mission (teaching), nice campus, opportunities for advancement, regular raises
cons: Mediocre salary, large bureaucracy, low agility, not a lot of room or opportunity to innovate, penny-pinching purchasers, slow hiring process

review_title: St. Cloud State University was a great place to learn and work.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Osseo, MN
pros: The perfect place to gain experience and begin to work together a professional portfolio. Meet lots of people and form many connections.
cons: Some people suck, ya know? The work itself was rewarding and I'm glad that I did it; but, like every job you'll ever have, some people are difficult to work with, but most people were awesome and friendly.

review_title: Graduate Assistant of Information Media Department
job_title: Graduate Assistant in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Wonderful job opportunity for graduate student. As a full time graduate assistant which requires 20 work hours per week, you will get tuition remission of up to 8 credits per semester plus stipend of $370 after tax per 2-week pay period.
cons: I had great time working here and I don't see any disadvantage of this job.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Sauk Rapids, MN
pros: As a Graduate Assistant at St. Cloud State offers shift flexibility and allows for leaving early and arriving late to accommodate class schedules. The tuition waiver is a big help in continuing education.
cons: The pay is low and the same across the board; it doesn't matter if you put in maximum effort or little effort, the pay is the same.

review_title: Great place to be a student worker
